node.title: 'You can't enter the stadiums': Cameron Smith issues blunt warning to unvaccinated NRL players
node.alt: An athletic middle-aged man in navy blue blazer and white shirt smiles at camera in front of sports trophy cabinet
node.description: Speaking at the City of Logan Sports AwardsÂ near Brisbane, Smith says NRL players who refuse to be vaccinated against COVID-19 will find it almost impossible to fulfil the requirements of their contracts.
node.content:
["Melbourne Storm and Queensland Maroons legend Cameron Smith warns\u00a0there will be \"obvious consequences\" for NRL players who refuse to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 before the 2022 season.", "The NRL has decided against following the AFL's lead by mandating vaccination, leaving it up to individual\u00a0choice.", "But Smith, 38, who retired in March after a record 433 games with the Storm over 19 seasons as hooker and occasional half-back, said state coronavirus laws would\u00a0make it almost impossible for unvaccinated players to take part.", "The NRL confirmed last week that players who were not vaccinated against COVID-19 would not be able to play or train in Victoria or Queensland as state borders opened up.", "For now, unvaccinated players will be able to train and play in NSW, but with strict protocols.", "\"It really doesn't matter the position the NRL has taken,\" Smith told the ABC at the City of Logan Sports Awards, south of Brisbane.", "\"So\u00a0there are consequences for [unvaccinated] athletes in the NRL competition.\"", "", "
Nelson Asofa-Solomona (centre) faces pressure to get vaccinated before the Storm's pre-season begins next month.(AAP: Lukas Coch)
", "Smith cited the example of his former Storm teammate Nelson Asofa-Solomona who has so far refused to get vaccinated, taking\u00a0a vocal stance against it on social media.", "\"Nelson's in a position that he's not vaccinated right now, so he won't be able to return to training at AAMI Park with the rest of the team until he is,\" Smith said.", "\"All I would say is that there are\u00a0obvious consequences if they choose not to.\"", "", "
Cameron Smith captained the Storm to the 2020 NRL premiership.(AAP: Dan Himbrechts)
", "Queensland-born Smith captained the Storm for 15 seasons, winning NRL premierships in 2012, 2017 and 2020.", "He recently returned to the Sunshine State after almost two decades in Victoria.", "
Dolphins 'make sense' as NRL's 17th team
", "Having grown\u00a0up as a Broncos\u00a0fan, he applauded\u00a0the NRL's choice\u00a0of the Dolphins as the competition's 17th team for 2023, with ex-Broncos' guru Wayne Bennett unveiled last month as the franchise's first coach.", "\"It makes sense to put another NRL team just north of Brisbane and I think it was a fairly straightforward decision, given the Dolphins' financial position and huge catchment in a very strong rugby league area,\" Smith said.", "\"It's a great decision to have Wayne Bennett\u00a0as their inaugural coach and I think they'll be looking to make a mark on the competition pretty early.", "\"Wayne has shown over the last couple of years \u2014 when people were questioning whether he should still be coaching \u2014 just how good he is, with both South Sydney and the Maroons.\"", "", "
Smith says the North Sydney Bears still\u00a0have a lot of fans despite exiting the competition in 1999.(file photo: Getty Images)
", "As for the NRL's potential 18th team, Smith agreed that foundation club, the North Sydney Bears, had a case to come back in some form, having been cut by league bosses in 1999.", "\"There's still a lot of North Sydney Bears supporters out there \u2026 they were a very good side in the 1990s, with some great Queenslanders, and I still remember watching them when I was a young fellow,\" he said.", "
Questions over NRL's depth for expansion
", "\"But I think the NRL and the commission will see how the Dolphins go for a few years before\u00a0another team is introduced to the competition. People have already asked,\u00a0'Is there enough talent to add another team now?'\"", "In addition to making the most\u00a0appearances, Smith holds a host of other NRL records, including all-time points scorer (2,810), most goals kicked (1,304) and most career wins (310).", "", "
Smith (right) with Queensland coach Mal Meninga after captaining the Maroons to victory in the 2015 State of Origin series.(Getty Images: Mark Kolbe)
", "He played 56 times for the Kangaroos between 2006-17 and made 42 Origin appearances for Queensland before retiring from representative football in 2017.", "
Written off as a footballer\u00a0in biology class
", "His return to Logan brought back memories of his days as a student at Marsden State High School where\u00a0his biology teacher told him he'd \"never make it as a professional footballer\".", "\"I don't know\u00a0but maybe that gave me a little bit more motivation, not that I needed too much more at the time.", "\"Not at any stage during my school years did I think I would have the career I've been fortunate enough to have.", "\"I ended up in Victoria, of all places, and it turned out pretty good for me.\"", "", "
